creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: head of elderly woman with large white headdress covering hair and ears; pensively looking downward; portion at L seems to be darker compared to grayish tone of other inking
inscription:
Signature, Date, Stamp

-- in ink on verso, bottom of sheet: \"Frederic Geissler procure a Paris, 1813.\"
-- in graphite on verso: 2 | 322 | 352
markings: blue stamp on verso, lower left: [V.D. in polygon], probably Von Döhn; also compare handwriting on verso with Lugt 1072 (J.M.F. Geissler)
provenance: Possibly Von Döhn sale, Paris 1813; sold to Geissler; ['Johann Martin Friedrich Geissler (1779-1853), sale, Leipzig, October 29, 1855]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate, center left: [RHL 1628] (with \"2\" reversed)
title: The Artist's Mother: Head Only, Full Face
